title: Jujutsu Infinite Innate Tier List
description: Discover the ultimate tier list for "Jujutsu Infinite" innate techniques, ranking abilities from S to C Tier with detailed descriptions of their powers and gameplay impact.
heading: Jujutsu Infinite Innate Tier List
introText: Discover the ultimate tier list for "Jujutsu Infinite" innate techniques, ranking abilities from S to C Tier with detailed descriptions of their powers and gameplay impact.

data.itemDescription: Features some of the strongest moves in the game, such as Total Collapse (a devastating black hole attack) and mass meter-based AOE attacks. Its versatility and variety make it exciting, with moves changing based on air position or mass meter fullness
Highly flexible for both PVP and PVE, boasting some of the most potent AOE moves and the strongest Domain Expansion in the game. If you roll Infinity, don’t reroll it
Enhanced with a fixed Jacob’s Ladder and a powerful Domain Expansion, this technique stands out. It can copy enemy moves while Jacob’s Ladder and the Domain deal massive damage
Sukuna's technique has solid abilities like World Cutting Slash and a strong Domain, but its combat moves need a bit more variety to reach S Tier
A Legendary technique that excels in PVE with powerful AOE damage moves like Fissures and Meteors. Great for wiping out swarms and bosses when paired with Damage and Rage buffs
A PVP and single-target powerhouse. Soul Touch is a near-instant hit grab attack dealing immense damage, and the self-buff is one of the best in the game
Versatile for single-target and AOE damage, offering slow and damage-reduction debuffs. The Death Swarm fish attack in the Domain is particularly enjoyable
Fun to use but held back by a weak Domain Expansion that lacks instant impact and reduces defenses after use
Potentially strong with the Executioner’s Sword, but the Domain Expansion’s unreliability keeps it from A Tier
While it lacks a proper Domain, Ratio shines with high damage output from moves like Unwavering Output after a 7:3 Strike
Offers great freeze combos for stunning opponents, but the absence of a strong Domain and Maximum moves limits its potential
Good for combos using nails and Hairpin, but its lack of raw power prevents it from climbing higher tiers
Choso's moveset has interesting mechanics like Blood Orb detonation but suffers from the absence of a full Domain and Maximum moves
Strong as a secondary technique for mobility and utility, with Swap and Counter Suplex being standout moves
Mid-tier AOE moves that are better than Commons but lack the damage or utility to compete with higher-tier techniques
